#summary The link element lets you define relationships between documents.
#labels about-html,is-html-element,from-w3c

You are here: [Welcome Home] > [HTMLReference HTML Reference] > [HTMLElements Elements] > *link element*

== Usage ==

The relationship that a `link` element defines is specified by the [LinkRelAttribute rel] attribute.  The related document is specified by the [LinkHrefAttribute href] attribute.

== Attributes ==

  * [LinkCharsetAttribute charset]
  * [LinkDisabledAttribute disabled]
  * [LinkHrefAttribute href]
  * [LinkHreflangAttribute hreflang]
  * [LinkMediaAttribute media]
  * [LinkMethodsAttribute methods]
  * [LinkNameAttribute name]
  * [LinkRelAttribute rel]
  * [LinkRevAttribute rev]
  * [LinkSrcAttribute src]
  * [LinkTargetAttribute target]
  * [LinkTitleAttribute title]
  * [LinkTypeAttribute type]
  * [CommonAttributes common attributes]
